title: Aptitudes and occupations: an introduction to vocational guidance
brief_description: Discusses six of the fundamental human aptitudes: social, mechanical, clerical, musical, artistic and scholastic; and indicates how a student may, with the help of an educational or vocational counsellor, determine in which of these aptitudes they are most gifted. Indicates the broad fields of employment in which certain combinations of abilities are required. Narrated by Vincent Pelletier.
